ngiemboon: Anò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn né Yelemî ńtí lùm ayɔɔn:
en: This is the word of the Lord that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought:

ngiemboon: «Epʉ̀a Yúndà ne ńdʉa,
en: Judah mourns;

ngiemboon: Mekěm tǔm megàŋafàʼ pɔ́b
en: Their nobles send their servants   for water.

ngiemboon: Atsetsáʼ áa jʉʼ ntsèm mbà á pǔ ńkaʼte;
en: The ground is cracked

ngiemboon: Áa tsɛ̀ɛ mbàʼ, mbà tsẅénɔ̀ɔn gwaʼá
en: Even the doe in the field

ngiemboon: Menzikáasè mbàʼ tyéte ndùm mekwɔʼɔ́ á kwòŋotsẅɛ.
en: Wild donkeys stand on the barren heights

ngiemboon: Aláʼ gɔɔn ngie:
en: Though our iniquities testify against us,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, gù gẅie pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ
en: Hope of Israel,

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ gÿo lêkɔ́ ńgÿo páʼ nyìŋ gẅie à te metʉ̀ gẅiin?
en: Why are you like a helpless man,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋe ńgɔɔn mbwó yɔɔn láʼ ŋwɛ́ ngie: «Oon, pɔ́ kwoŋo le gwá ńgiŋ té pá ndyèen. Pɔ́ té néŋe tàʼa jʉʼ wɔ́.» Púʼu, á té Cʉ̀apʉ̀a poŋ. À ge kímte mefʉa mɔ́b fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, é tém ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ twó pɔ́b, ńtí menò tepòŋ mɔ́b.
en: This is what the Lord says concerning these people:

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né mèŋ ngie: «Te sẅíŋte wɔ́ɔn ngie mèŋ gÿo nò mbòŋo mbwó pʉ̀a pɔɔn ŋwɛ́.
en: Then the Lord said to me, “Do not pray for the well-being of these people.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔɔn ńzɔɔn ńkwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, mbà n te júʼu sẅíŋtè yɔ́b wɔ́. Ńzɔɔn ńdɔg pɔ́ pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, ńtó ńnuŋe mvfò mèŋ, ḿmaʼ mbɔɔ ncùb ńná né mèŋ, mbà n te kẅé wɔ́. Táʼ, n ge lɔg ncù pɔ́ cÿó, lâ gwáʼa, é zẅéte wɔ́b.»
en: If they fast, I will not hear their cry of despair. If they offer burnt offering and grain offering, I will not accept them. Rather, I will finish them off by sword, famine, and plague.”

ngiemboon: Yelemî tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Wɛ̌ɛ! Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé ne ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie mé té gÿo lɔg nně ncù lÿɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b wɔ́, gwáŋa ké le láʼ pɔ́b gwe. E Ssé ge gÿo gÿo pɔ́ shÿéenshÿéen ńnéŋe lé mbʉ́lè.»
en: And I replied, “Oh no, Lord God! The prophets are telling them, ‘You won’t see sword or suffer famine. I will certainly give you lasting peace in this place.’ ”

ngiemboon: N da gɔɔn púʼu, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a pÿɛ ngie: Pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé apɛ̌ ne ńgɔɔn ngie pɔ́ lɔgɔ lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńgɔɔn nò; táʼ, ńdɔgɔ ńcÿɔɔ nò. N ka te wɔ́b túm, ńké te tsẅii nò mbwó pɔ́b wɔ́, ńké te gɔɔn tsɔ́ nò né pɔ́b wɔ́. Menò mie pɔ́ shwóŋo gẅí ngie pɔ́ gyǎ, é gwɔ́ pɔ́ cÿɔ̌nò, pɔ́ kwaŋte kwaŋte ńgɔɔn. Menò mie pɔ́ gwaa ḿbÿé, á té tsɔ́ nò wɔ́; pɔ́ zɔ̌ kwaŋa ńgɔɔn.
en: But the Lord said to me, “These prophets are prophesying a lie in my name. I did not send them, nor did I command them or speak to them. They are prophesying to you a false vision, worthless divination, the deceit   of their own minds.  # 14:14 Jr 5:31; 20:6; 23:25–26,32; 27:10,14–16; 29:9,21,31

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a n gɔɔn nò ńtí pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé apɛ̌ ngie: Pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé ŋwɛ́ ne ńdɔgɔ lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn, ńgɔɔn nò táʼ, n ka te wɔ́b túm. Pɔ́ ne ńgɔɔn ngie ngwɔ́ nně ncù pɔ́ gwáŋa le gwe tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn láʼ wɔ́. Ḿbiŋe ńgɔɔn púʼu, nně ncù pɔ́ gwáŋa zɔ ké ńdáʼ ḿbú ńzẅéte wɔ́b.
en: “Therefore, this is what the Lord says concerning the prophets who prophesy in my name, though I did not send them, and who say, ‘There will never be sword or famine in this land.’ By sword and famine these prophets will meet their end.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na pʉ̀a pie pantsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé la pÿé yɔɔn nò mbwó pɔ́b, mbà gwáŋa pɔ́ ncù ge gÿo pú zẅéte wɔ́b, mepfó mɔ́b nuŋte metwó nzsè Yelúzálèm, nyìŋ gẅie à ge túŋo wɔ́b, á le gwɔ́ wó wɔ́: á wɔ́b, é mezwě pɔ́b, é gubé yɔ́b yembàŋa mbɔɔ yepanzwě. N ge gÿo gÿo, menò tepòŋ mie pɔ́ ka tɔ́ɔn, e sẅɛ́ʼɛ twó pɔ́b.
en: The people they are prophesying to will be thrown into the streets of Jerusalem because of the famine and the sword. There will be no one to bury them    #— #they, their wives, their sons, and their daughters. I will pour out their own evil on them.”

ngiemboon: «Gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie:
en: You are to speak this word to them:

ngiemboon: N dɔɔn ńkúu menkáʼ fʉ̀ʼʉ kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ,
en: If I go out to the field,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, tsye ɔ̀ kéen ńgwáʼa láʼa Yúndà ka?
en: Have you completely rejected Judah?

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, peg zsé
en: We acknowledge our wickedness,  Lord,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńcʉa na lezíŋ shú,
en: For your name’s sake, don’t despise us.

ngiemboon: Á gʉa na tsɔ́ messé mie ée tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ,
en: Can any of the worthless idols of the nations   bring rain?
